ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I truly gained a lot of knowledge on how to do research and on different topics related to Africa.
I gained knowledge on the variety of research topics and approaches relating to Africa. I also gained valuable instruction on forming a research project proposal.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: So many strengths: all of the weeks seemed necessary and the material interesting.

I think the invitation of instructors was helpful in exposure to the variety of work that can be done. I do wish there were more professors in the Humanities. I found the instruction on the proposal helpful, however, I wish we spent more class time on this aspect.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I am recommending this to so many students interested in Africa in general.
I would recommend this course to students, depending on their area of interest, who are looking for an introduction to research in Africa.
